intro: Scabiosa columbaria subsp. gramuntia, commonly known as the lesser scabious, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and rocky habitats. This species is valued in gardens for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting pollinators.
